Class HierarchicalFacet

This component inherits all of its options and behavior from the normal Facet component, but is meant to be used for hierarchical values.
The HierarchicalFacet component could be used to display files in a file system, or categories for documents in a hierarchy.
This facet require a group by field with a special format in order to work correctly.
Let's say we have the following files indexed on a filesystem:

C:\
   folder1\
       text1.txt
   folder2\
     folder3\
       text2.txt

The document text1.txt would need to have a field with the following format:
@field : c; c|folder1;
The document text2.txt would have a field with the following format:
@field: c; c|folder2; c|folder2|folder3;
The | character allows the facet to build its hierarchy (folder3 inside folder2 inside c)
Since both documents contain the c value, selecting that value in the facet would return both documents.
Selecting the folder3 value in the facet would only return the text2.txt document.

Component Options

delimitingCharacter

delimitingCharacter: string
  • Defined in src/ui/HierarchicalFacet/HierarchicalFacet.ts :86

The character that allows to specify the hierarchy dependency.
The default value is |.
For example, if your field has the following values : @field: c; c>folder2; c>folder2>folder3; Then your delimiting character would be >

levelEnd

levelEnd: number
  • Defined in src/ui/HierarchicalFacet/HierarchicalFacet.ts :106

Specifies at which level (0 based index) of the hierarchy you want your facet to stop displaying it's values.
The default value is undefined, meaning it will render all levels.

levelStart

levelStart: number
  • Defined in src/ui/HierarchicalFacet/HierarchicalFacet.ts :101

Specifies at which level (0 based index) of the hierarchy you want your facet to start displaying it's values.
The default value is 0.
Using this example :

C:\
   folder1\
       text1.txt
   folder2\
     folder3\
       text2.txt

Setting levelStart to 1 would only display folder1 and folder2, and omit c:

marginByLevel

marginByLevel: number
  • Defined in src/ui/HierarchicalFacet/HierarchicalFacet.ts :111

Specifies the margin, in pixel, between each level, when they are expanded.
Default value is 10.

Static get

  • get(element: HTMLElement, componentClass?: any, noThrow?: boolean): BaseComponent

  • Inherited from Component.get

    • Defined in src/ui/Base/Component.ts :177

    Get the bound component to the given HTMLElement. Throws an assert if the HTMLElement has no component bound, unless using the noThrow argument
    If there is multiple component bound to the current HTMLElement, you must specify the component class

    Parameters

    • element: HTMLElement

      HTMLElement for which to get the bound component

    • Optional componentClass: any

      Optional component class. If the HTMLElement has multiple components bound, you must specify which one you are targeting

    • Optional noThrow: boolean

      Boolean option to tell the method to not throw on error

    Returns BaseComponent
